Posted By: Atali (7/7/2012 11:51:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The flexibility of this card is what defines it. Being able to take out beef, or wiping three teeny duders, really makes it. This is a great addition to a red burn deck, just like it's predecessor, [Arc Lightning.](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Lightning.)  
  
 And hey -- now you can get more of them in your deck! If you... really need to, I guess?

Posted By: LordOfTheFlies87 (7/6/2012 6:20:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Yeah I appreciate the functional reprint of Arc Lightning with some extra Chandra flavor. Pretty terrific in limited, but as far as constructed goes, not quite there. Most of the players who define my local meta (including myself obviously) opt for [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail) since the flexibility trade-off is rather marginal and the cost differential (![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) vs ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)) is, perhaps surprisingly, fairly substantial.
posts.html:

Posted By: Masqueradox (8/2/2012 6:27:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm *so* torn on this card. It's usually worse than [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail) in that it costs 50% more. Then again, once we hit rotation, M13/Innistrad tones things down a bit in terms of the numbers you see on creatures, which means they have accordingly toned down wipes (no [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm), [Slagstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagstorm), [Whipflare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whipflare), [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment), [Black Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Sun's Zenith)...) So maybe it's OK that this is a little less powerful than [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail). The things it needs to answer are a little less powerful too. Plus, when this card was last printed under the name [Arc Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Lightning), it scored an average 4.250 to Flames of the Firebrand's 3.212. Which tells you the card isn't too bad, it's just that cards that do the same thing have gotten better. And now it looks like they're going to get scaled back a bit.  
  
Added to that, you can burn 3-toughness creatures with t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I'm so torn on this card. It's usually worse than Arc Trail in that it costs 50% more. Then again, once we hit rotation, M13/Innistrad tones things down a bit in terms of the numbers you see on creatures, which means they have accordingly toned down wipes (no Pyroclasm, Slagstorm, Whipflare, Day of Judgment, Black Sun's Zenith...) So maybe it's OK that this is a little less powerful than Arc Trail. The things it needs to answer are a little less powerful too. Plus, when this card was last printed under the name Arc Lightning, it scored an average 4.250 to Flames of the Firebrand's 3.212. Which tells you the card isn't too bad, it's just that cards that do the same thing have gotten better. And now it looks like they're going to get scaled back a bit.
